concept.title: Console - Monitor Mode
concept.shortdesc: In Monitor mode, you can use the console to view data as it passes through the pipeline.

conbody.p: The following image shows the console in Monitor mode:Retake screenshot, update table below - add extra crap

strow.stentry: Displays the pipeline that the is running. You can click a stage to view statistics about the stage. Click an empty part of the canvas to view pipeline statistics.

Displays statistics for the pipeline or selected stage.
When you click an Inspect Data icon... come back to this.
When you click the Snapshot button, displays a snapshot of data that moved through the pipeline.
Lists the pipeline and stages in the pipeline. Use to select the information that you want to view.
Displays data inspection information. come back to this.
Captures a snapshot of data passing through the pipeline so you can review the details of the data, like data preview.

stentry.p: Displays the record count for the pipeline, record and batch throughput for the pipeline or individual stages, and batch processing statistics for the pipeline or individual stages.
stentry.note: You can hover over different parts of the charts to view exact numbers.

strow.stentry:
For a pipeline, displays histograms for the number of error records by five minute decay and the number of error records by stage since the pipeline started.
For a stage, displays the number of error records and the number of stage errors.
Displays configuration information for the pipeline or selected stage. You cannot configure the pipeline when it is running.
Displays the status and history of the pipeline.
